reviewDescription: I have used Alexa for last five years and is still working nicely.I am so much satisfied with it that I decided to use many Internet of Things (IoT) devices in my home. It started with Atomberg fans. I can start it even during fast sleep by uttering the commands. It is so simple and convenient. There is no need to search remote control or change cells on remote controls.Then I purchased Lloyd air conditioner which is compatible with Alexa. It also works with its own voice recognition system.I am now also using Wipro bulbs and plugs. They work well with Alexa.I got so much satisfaction with Alexa that I ordered another piece (the present one). It is the least expensive of Assistance and does its job fantastic way.I can also automatically control and schedule using Alexa.Alexa also tells me jokes, news, plays songs remind me about assignments work as timers reading notifications.Presently it does not work with Sony Bravia. That is the only drawback I noticed. I am thinking about purchasing Amazon fire stick to go round the problem.

reviewTitle: A Compact Powerhouse of Sound and Smart Features
reviewDescription: After using the Echo Pop Smart Speaker for a few weeks, I am eager to share my thoughts on this nifty little device. The model I purchased is in a vibrant purple shade, which adds a fun pop of colour to my room.First and foremost, the sound quality is remarkable for a speaker of its size. The Echo Pop delivers a loud and clear sound with a balanced bass and crisp vocals. Whether I'm listening to my favourite tunes, a podcast, or an audiobook, the audio quality is consistently pleasing with no distortion, even at higher volumes. It's impressive how it fills my room with sound, making it perfect for personal use or a small gathering.The design of the Echo Pop is sleek and modern, and it's small enough to blend seamlessly into any decor without taking up much space. The fact that it comes in four colours (black, white, green, and purple) is a bonus, allowing you to choose one that best fits your style.One of the standout features of the Echo Pop is its integration with Alexa. The convenience of playing music hands-free from various streaming services like Amazon Music, Spotify, and Apple Music just by asking Alexa is a game changer. It's important to note, though, that some of these services may require a subscription.The ability to voice-control smart devices around the house is another excellent feature. I've used it to control smart lights, my TV, and even my AC. The fact that you can extend these capabilities to non-smart appliances using smart plugs (sold separately) is quite fascinating and shows the potential of making your home smarter and more connected.I particularly enjoy asking Alexa to play nursery rhymes for my niece and set alarms and reminders. It's also become a part of my morning routine to get news updates and weather forecasts while I’m getting ready for the day.The Echo Pop also doubles as a Bluetooth speaker, allowing me to pair it with my phone and play audio from apps that aren't supported directly through Alexa. This flexibility is a significant plus.Finally, the built-in privacy features, including the mic-off button, give me peace of mind. It’s reassuring to know that I have control over my privacy and can disable the microphone whenever I want.In conclusion, the Echo Pop is a fantastic smart speaker that offers a lot for its size and price. Its sound quality, stylish design, smart features, and versatility make it a great addition to any room. Whether you're new to smart speakers or looking to add another one to your home, the Echo Pop is an excellent choice.

It is recommended from my side to make your home AI enabled.

reviewTitle: It's frustratingly okay at this moment!
reviewDescription: Today I got my hands on Alex Pop, and after running some updates, configuring settings, and adding skills and blueprints, here’s what I’ve figured out.Pros-1. Sound quality is incredible—clear and loud sounds great!2. You get a totally different experience.3. Pairs up perfectly with smart IT-enabled devices.Cons-1. It's really slow on the uptake; even the most basic queries get responses like 'Sorry, I don't understand' or 'Sorry, can't do that right now.' It's kind of dumb, and you'll need to grab some AI skills from the marketplace to make it smarter.2. It heats up a bit even when I'm not using it.Feedback: You guys should think about integrating a sophisticated AI LLM model like ChatGPT. Amazon has some solid LLMs; why not just blend one with Alexa?

reviewTitle: Worst Packaging. Suspect it to be Used or Refurbished.
reviewDescription: I got this Echo Pop today, and frankly I was shocked by its packaging. The packing box was fully open and the Echo Pop device was outside the box (but inside the delivery envelope of amazon). There was no tape or seal on the box. Also there was no plastic packing of the Echo Pop inside the Box, it was just stashed in, and I am naturally suspecting that it is either a returned device or a refurbished one. The saving grace is that it is working on first use and I will observe for a few days, and if any issue will return it. But I am really sad to see that Amazon, being such a big company, is not adhering to quality control standards. The very least a customer deserves: is to be given the delight of a product purchase, with proper packaging and the feeling of new, and not of used and second hand, and worst the uncertainty over quality. Charge 50-100 bucks extra but please deliver with care and in proper condition.
